reinforcements.existing_element_title: Save-and-Resume: The Platform Remembers Where You Stopped
reinforcements.similarity: Both address preserving the host's work and state across interruptions. The existing element (from the Kahneman lens) prescribes that multi-step processes remember where the host stopped, allowing resume without repetition. The new element (Solitude-Companionship Oscillation Manager, from the Flow/Ch8 lens) extends state-preservation from wizard progress to the host's lived temporal rhythm: the weekly rhythm strip shows not just what was saved but what the week looks like -- when the guest is present, when the host has solitude, and how date changes affect this oscillation.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman's Save-and-Resume (existing) handles the cognitive cost of re-orientation after a break. Csikszentmihalyi's rhythm manager (new) handles the emotional cost of temporal uncertainty during active lease. Combined: the platform must preserve both administrative state (where did I stop in the wizard) AND experiential state (what does my week look like). Save-and-Resume operates at the task level; the oscillation manager operates at the life-rhythm level. These are complementary scales of the same design principle: the platform remembers so the host does not have to.

phase_coverage.listing_creation: Save-and-Resume preserves wizard progress; Oscillation Manager prescribes quiet hours and private spaces in House Rules step
phase_coverage.pricing: Save-and-Resume preserves pricing step state; Oscillation Manager not directly relevant
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: not directly addressed by either element at this phase
phase_coverage.active_lease: Oscillation Manager provides full temporal rhythm visibility; Save-and-Resume not relevant (lease is live, not paused)
phase_coverage.retention: Oscillation Manager's rhythm data feeds into the lease-end growth narrative

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Sequential Disclosure: One Question at a Time, in the Call's Order
reinforcements.similarity: Both address how the listing wizard should feel. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes showing one question cluster at a time in the conversational order the host experienced during their agent call. The new element (Differentiation Wizard, from Flow/Ch8) reframes the wizard as a structured self-expression exercise where the host articulates their unique identity, not just fills forms. Both operate on listing_creation but address different dimensions.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Sequential Disclosure (existing) handles the cognitive pacing: one cluster at a time prevents depletion. The Differentiation Wizard (new) handles the creative challenge: the host must express their 'own civilization' (Csikszentmihalyi's Dorothy metaphor), not just enter data. Combined: the wizard should present one expression challenge at a time (sequential) while scaffolding genuine self-expression (differentiation). The order should follow the agent call's conversational flow (existing) but the prompts should invite personality, not just data (new). These are complementary -- pacing from Kahneman, creative framing from Csikszentmihalyi.

phase_coverage.listing_creation: Sequential Disclosure governs pacing; Differentiation Wizard governs content quality. Merge: one question at a time, each question framed as a self-expression prompt rather than a data field
phase_coverage.pricing: Both address pricing: Sequential Disclosure keeps pricing as one step; Differentiation Wizard adds market-range calibration. Combined: one-step pricing with liberating default and contextual range
phase_coverage.active_lease: not addressed by either element at this phase

reinforcements.similarity: Both address how the platform communicates with the host during active engagement. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes that every notification continues the host's current mental context rather than disrupting it. The new element (Cohabitation Flow Engine, from Flow/Ch8) adds per-stay reciprocal feedback, House Manual evolution, and escalating challenges throughout the lease. Both operate during active_lease but at different scales.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Notifications as Continuation (existing) handles the delivery mechanism: every alert must feel like a continuation of what the host is already thinking about. The Cohabitation Flow Engine (new) defines what content those notifications carry: per-stay review prompts, House Manual update suggestions, date-change impact data. Combined: the notification infrastructure (existing) should deliver the cohabitation flow content (new). Per-stay review prompts should feel like natural continuations of the host's weekly rhythm, not system-generated interruptions.

phase_coverage.listing_creation: not addressed by either element at this phase
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: not addressed by either element at this phase
phase_coverage.active_lease: Notifications as Continuation governs delivery; Cohabitation Flow Engine governs content (reciprocal feedback, escalating challenges, common goals). Full coverage together.
phase_coverage.retention: Cohabitation Flow Engine's cumulative data feeds the lease-end summary

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Forward Momentum at the Close: Every Interaction Should End Looking Ahead
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the transition from one engagement period to the next. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes that every interaction closes with a forward-looking next step, preventing the dead-end feeling that causes dropout. The new element (Autotelic Host Development, from Flow/Ch8) extends this from micro-interaction closes to the macro-journey arc: the host's entire experience should develop intrinsic motivation, culminating in a lease-end growth narrative that bridges to the next engagement.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Forward Momentum (existing) operates at every touchpoint close: 'Your listing is saved -- next, add photos.' Autotelic Development (new) operates at the journey arc level: 'Over 13 weeks, your hosting skills grew. Here is what you could do next.' Combined: micro-momentum (existing) sustains engagement within phases; macro-development (new) sustains engagement across the entire hosting lifecycle. The lease-end growth narrative IS the largest-scale forward momentum moment.

phase_coverage.discovery: Forward Momentum provides next-step framing at discovery close
phase_coverage.evaluation: Forward Momentum provides next-step framing at evaluation close
phase_coverage.onboarding: Forward Momentum bridges onboarding to listing creation
phase_coverage.listing_creation: Forward Momentum bridges each wizard step; not directly covered by Autotelic Development
phase_coverage.pricing: Forward Momentum bridges pricing acceptance to the next step
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Forward Momentum bridges proposal response to next action
phase_coverage.active_lease: Autotelic Development surfaces non-financial milestones; Forward Momentum ensures each review prompt ends with forward context
phase_coverage.retention: Autotelic Development provides the growth narrative and forward-looking challenges that are the highest-stakes application of Forward Momentum

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Pre-Packaged Proposal: Present Decisions as Confirmations, Not Constructions
reinforcements.similarity: Both address proposal interaction design. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes pre-populated proposal presentation so hosts confirm rather than construct decisions. The new element (Proposal Evaluation as Social Assessment, from Flow/Ch8) reframes proposal management from a transactional confirmation to a social assessment: the host is evaluating not just terms but the person behind them. The dual-column layout with terms and social profile extends the pre-packaged concept into social territory.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Pre-Packaged Proposal (existing) reduces the cognitive effort of evaluating terms by pre-structuring them. Social Assessment (new) adds the missing human dimension: guest verification, reviews, communication quality. Combined: the proposal should be both pre-packaged (terms already organized for quick scanning) AND socially contextualized (the person behind the terms is visible alongside them). The counter-proposal as creative reframing (new) extends the confirm-not-construct principle: the host edits in place rather than constructing a new proposal from scratch.

phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Full coverage: Pre-Packaged handles terms presentation; Social Assessment handles person evaluation. Merge: dual-column layout with pre-populated terms (left) and social profile (right)
phase_coverage.active_lease: not addressed by either element at this phase

reinforcements.existing_element_title: The Human Thread: The Host Should Always Feel One Step from a Real Person
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the host's need for human connection within the platform. The existing element (from Kahneman) ensures the host always feels one step from a real person (agent, support). The new element (Wider Community as Retention Infrastructure, from Flow/Ch8) extends this from platform-provided human connection to host-to-host human connection: mentoring, neighborhood networks, community participation. Both serve retention but at different social scales.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: The Human Thread (existing) provides vertical connection: host to platform representatives. Wider Community (new) provides horizontal connection: host to other hosts. Csikszentmihalyi's Chapter 8 insight is that 'the larger the social arena one moves in, the greater the challenges it presents' (lines 1059-1060). Combined: the platform provides both vertical support (agent accessibility) and horizontal community (host mentoring and networks). The human thread ensures no host feels alone; the wider community ensures experienced hosts do not feel bored.

phase_coverage.evaluation: Human Thread provides agent accessibility during comparison
phase_coverage.onboarding: Human Thread provides agent call as the primary onboarding mechanism
phase_coverage.listing_creation: Human Thread provides agent support during wizard; not covered by Wider Community
phase_coverage.pricing: Human Thread provides agent guidance on pricing
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Human Thread provides agent support for difficult decisions
phase_coverage.active_lease: Human Thread provides ongoing support; Wider Community not active during first lease
phase_coverage.retention: Both fully active: Human Thread for platform support, Wider Community for mentoring and neighborhood networks

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Anchor-Then-Advance: Open Every Screen with What the Host Already Knows
reinforcements.similarity: Both address information hierarchy in the host's primary views. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes opening every screen with what the host already knows (anchor) before introducing new information (advance). The new element (Solitude-Companionship Rhythm Strip, from Flow/Ch8) specifies the exact information architecture for the Stays Manager's primary view: a 7-day horizontal strip showing guest-present, guest-absent, and transition states as the temporal anchor.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Anchor-Then-Advance (existing) provides the general principle: lead with the familiar. The Rhythm Strip (new) is a specific instantiation: the host's week IS what they already know, and the strip anchors them in that knowledge before surfacing action items. Combined: the Stays Manager should open with the rhythm strip (temporal anchor -- what my week looks like) before the action band (what needs my attention) and main content (what is new). The strip IS the anchor; the action items are the advance.

phase_coverage.discovery: Anchor-Then-Advance applies to landing page design
phase_coverage.onboarding: Anchor-Then-Advance applies to post-call platform entry
phase_coverage.listing_creation: Anchor-Then-Advance applies to wizard step transitions
phase_coverage.pricing: Anchor-Then-Advance applies to pricing step (show current price before range)
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Anchor-Then-Advance applies to proposal card opening (show quality indicator first)
phase_coverage.active_lease: Rhythm Strip IS the anchor for the Stays Manager. Full coverage.
phase_coverage.retention: Anchor-Then-Advance applies to lease-end summary (show growth narrative before financial summary)

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Trust Credential Stack: Process Before Promise, Verification Before Claim
reinforcements.similarity: Both address how trust information is structured. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes showing verification mechanisms before trust claims. The new element (Reciprocal Feedback Loop, from Flow/Ch8) adds ongoing trust generation through per-stay micro-reviews that create bidirectional feedback between host and guest throughout the lease.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Trust Credential Stack (existing) handles pre-commitment trust: show the guest is verified before promising compatibility. Reciprocal Feedback Loop (new) handles in-lease trust maintenance: show ongoing review data that confirms the arrangement is working. Combined: trust is established through credentials (existing) and maintained through feedback (new). The micro-review system produces the trust data that future Trust Credential Stacks will display for this guest.

phase_coverage.discovery: Trust Credential Stack provides platform legitimacy signals
phase_coverage.evaluation: Trust Credential Stack provides verification evidence
phase_coverage.onboarding: Trust Credential Stack provides agent credibility
phase_coverage.listing_creation: not directly addressed by either element
phase_coverage.pricing: not directly addressed by either element
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Trust Credential Stack shows guest verification; Reciprocal Feedback shows guest review history from prior stays
phase_coverage.active_lease: Reciprocal Feedback Loop provides per-stay micro-reviews. Full coverage.
phase_coverage.retention: Reciprocal Feedback Loop's accumulated reviews feed the growth narrative and provide trust evidence for future guests

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Instant Acknowledgment on Every Host Input
reinforcements.similarity: Both address micro-interaction timing for host actions. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes sub-200ms acknowledgment on every host input to prevent cognitive uncertainty. The new element (Arrival-Departure Ritual Interactions, from Flow/Ch8) specifies the exact interaction pattern for the two most emotionally loaded recurring micro-interactions: acknowledging guest arrival and acknowledging guest departure with cleaning photos.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Instant Acknowledgment (existing) provides the timing specification: every tap gets sub-200ms response. Arrival-Departure Rituals (new) define the specific interactions where this timing matters most: the one-tap 'Got it -- welcome' and 'Looks good' acknowledgments that structure solitude-companionship transitions. Combined: the rituals are the highest-stakes application of the instant acknowledgment principle. The tap must feel instant AND the visual transformation must feel purposeful.

phase_coverage.discovery: not addressed by Rituals; Instant Acknowledgment applies generically
phase_coverage.evaluation: not addressed by Rituals; Instant Acknowledgment applies generically
phase_coverage.onboarding: not addressed by Rituals; Instant Acknowledgment applies generically
phase_coverage.listing_creation: not addressed by Rituals; Instant Acknowledgment applies to wizard interactions
phase_coverage.pricing: not addressed by Rituals; Instant Acknowledgment applies to pricing input
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: not addressed by Rituals; Instant Acknowledgment applies to proposal actions
phase_coverage.active_lease: Rituals provide the specific arrival/departure interaction patterns. Full coverage together with Instant Acknowledgment for timing.

reinforcements.existing_element_title: Motion as Confirmation, Not Decoration: Sub-100ms Acknowledgment, 300ms Settle
reinforcements.similarity: Both address how the platform uses animation to communicate state changes. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes sub-100ms acknowledgment and 300ms settle as the motion language for confirmations, reserving animation exclusively for functional feedback. The new element (Stays Manager Phase Evolution, from Flow/Ch8) describes how the Stays Manager's content silently evolves across three lease phases (orientation weeks 1-3, rhythm weeks 4-9, reflection weeks 10-13) with specific animation choices: spring easing for Phase 1 checklists, ease-out for Phase 2 progress bars, no animation for phase transitions.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Motion as Confirmation (existing) provides the timing constraint: animation exists only to confirm, never to decorate. Phase Evolution (new) applies this within the Stays Manager: checklist check animations use spring easing (welcoming in Phase 1), progress bar fills use ease-out (natural deceleration in Phase 2), and phase transitions have NO animation (avoiding attention to the shift). Combined: motion confirms micro-actions within each phase (existing); the absence of motion at phase transitions preserves the illusion of organic evolution (new).

phase_coverage.listing_creation: Motion as Confirmation applies to wizard step transitions
phase_coverage.pricing: Motion as Confirmation applies to price input feedback
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Motion as Confirmation applies to proposal card interactions
phase_coverage.active_lease: Phase Evolution provides the complete Stays Manager animation strategy across 13+ weeks. Full coverage together.
phase_coverage.retention: Phase Evolution's Phase 3 (reflection) bridges to the lease-end summary

reinforcements.existing_element_title: The Advisor Glow: When the Host Feels Like an Expert, They Stay
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the host's emotional experience during self-expression moments. The existing element (from Kahneman) identifies that hosts who are prompted to share their expertise (about their neighborhood, their space, their hosting knowledge) experience a confidence glow that deepens commitment. The new element (Listing Creation as Self-Portrait, from Flow/Ch8) extends this from expertise-sharing to self-expression: the host is not just advising but painting a self-portrait of their home through the listing wizard.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Advisor Glow (existing) triggers when the host shares expertise ('What makes your neighborhood special?'). Self-Portrait (new) triggers when the host expresses identity ('What does your kitchen look like at 8am?'). Combined: the listing wizard should invoke both feelings -- the confidence of being an expert AND the creative pride of expressing one's home identity. The advisor prompts (existing) should evolve into self-portrait prompts (new) as the wizard deepens from factual (Step 1) to personal (Step 5-6).

phase_coverage.discovery: not addressed by either element directly
phase_coverage.evaluation: not addressed by either element directly
phase_coverage.onboarding: Advisor Glow triggers during the agent call when the host shares property expertise
phase_coverage.listing_creation: Full merged coverage: Advisor Glow (early steps, factual expertise) evolves into Self-Portrait (later steps, personal expression)
phase_coverage.pricing: Advisor Glow applies (the host's knowledge of their market); Self-Portrait not directly relevant
phase_coverage.active_lease: not addressed by either element directly at this phase
phase_coverage.retention: Self-Portrait's differentiation work feeds the growth narrative (the host sees how well they expressed their space)

reinforcements.existing_element_title: The Relief of Guaranteed Income: Show the Money, Then Show Why It's Safe
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the host's financial-emotional experience but at opposite ends of the journey. The existing element (from Kahneman) prescribes showing guaranteed income prominently to create relief at pre-commitment stages. The new element (Lease End as Harvest, from Flow/Ch8) reframes the lease-end financial summary as secondary to the growth narrative -- deliberately subordinating the money to the meaning.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Income Relief (existing) works pre-commitment: showing the money first creates the emotional safety that enables the host to proceed with listing creation and proposal acceptance. Lease-End Harvest (new) works post-completion: showing growth before money reframes the host's retrospective from 'was the money worth the hassle?' to 'did hosting make me more capable?' Combined: money leads at the beginning of the journey (when the host needs financial reassurance) and follows at the end (when the host needs growth recognition). The emotional arc inverts the financial emphasis: money-first at discovery, meaning-first at retention.

phase_coverage.discovery: Income Relief provides financial reassurance at first encounter
phase_coverage.evaluation: Income Relief supports comparison by showing guaranteed amounts
phase_coverage.onboarding: Income Relief reinforces the agent's financial promises
phase_coverage.listing_creation: Income Relief surfaces income estimates during pricing step
phase_coverage.pricing: Income Relief prominently displays expected income; Harvest not relevant yet
phase_coverage.proposal_mgmt: Income Relief shows per-proposal financial impact
phase_coverage.active_lease: Income Relief shows per-stay payment confirmations; Harvest not relevant yet
phase_coverage.retention: Lease-End Harvest provides the growth-first, money-second lease-end summary. Full coverage together.

gaps.gap: No existing library element addresses the host's need for a living, editable House Manual during active lease. The current library treats the House Manual as a static listing-creation artifact. The new element behaves-004 (House Manual as Living Document) fills this gap by making the Manual editable with guest notifications and a change log. This is a genuinely novel element with no library equivalent.

No existing library element addresses the temporal rhythm visualization that hosts need during active lease. The rhythm strip (communicates-001 in this run) showing guest-present/guest-absent/transition days is novel -- the library has urgency surfacing and dashboard patterns but nothing that visualizes the host's weekly solitude-companionship oscillation as a primary information element.

No existing library element addresses host-to-host community as a retention mechanism. The library's retention elements focus on forward momentum and financial reassurance. Csikszentmihalyi's wider-community insight (works-006 in this run) -- that escalating social challenges through mentoring and neighborhood networks sustain engagement beyond what any individual lease can provide -- is entirely novel.

No existing library element frames the lease-end summary as a growth narrative rather than a financial statement. The library has income display patterns (feels-002) but no pattern for surfacing intrinsic hosting growth (milestones, skills developed, guest appreciation). The new communicates-005 (Autotelic Growth Narrative) fills this gap.

phase_coverage_assessment.discovery: Well covered by existing library (Trust Gate, Income Relief, Forward Momentum). New elements add Flow-specific framing but do not introduce novel discovery patterns.
phase_coverage_assessment.evaluation: Well covered by existing library. New elements add the solitude-companionship lens but evaluation mechanics are addressed.
phase_coverage_assessment.onboarding: Well covered by existing library (Human Thread, Trust Credential Stack, Agent Continuity). New elements add agent-call-as-flow-demonstration framing.
phase_coverage_assessment.listing_creation: Strong new contribution: Differentiation Wizard + Self-Portrait emotional design merge with Sequential Disclosure to create a qualitatively richer listing experience. The differentiation calibration signals (communicates-002) are novel.
phase_coverage_assessment.pricing: Adequately covered by existing library with new Flow-specific enhancement: pricing defaults as 'liberating constraints' (Csikszentmihalyi's Cicero insight) adds emotional framing to existing mechanics.
phase_coverage_assessment.proposal_mgmt: Strong new contribution: Social Assessment dual-column layout + Counter-Proposal as creative reframing merge with Pre-Packaged Proposal to create a richer proposal evaluation experience.
phase_coverage_assessment.active_lease: Strongest new contribution of this run. Rhythm Strip, Cohabitation Flow Engine, Arrival-Departure Rituals, Stays Manager Phase Evolution, House Manual as Living Document, and Per-Stay Micro-Reviews collectively create a comprehensive active-lease experience framework that the library previously lacked at this depth. The host's active-lease emotional and interactional experience was the least-developed area of the library.
phase_coverage_assessment.retention: Strong new contribution: Autotelic Development Arc, Lease-End Harvest narrative, Wider Community infrastructure, and Pause-as-Solitude-Recovery collectively reframe retention from financial dependency to intrinsic growth motivation. Novel.
